work.title: Featured Work
work.subtitle: Three engagements that shaped my system-level approach to fintech architecture.

cases.role: Senior Product Engineer · Acting Technical Lead
cases.title: Debt Publication Platform
cases.summary: Acted as Technical Lead in the white-label transformation of an enterprise payment product, driving a multi-company debt publishing model across shared and market-specific constraints.
cases.challenge: Debt creation was blocked by inconsistencies across agreement variants, legacy assumptions, and orchestration behavior that did not scale to complex agreement types.
cases.approach: Applied system-level reasoning across layers: redesigned frontend flows, improved backend validation rules for complex agreement types, resolved data inconsistencies that blocked debt creation, and debugged/fixed a .NET orchestrator issue preventing agreement generation.
cases.outcome: Established a reusable white-label model with clearer boundaries between UI, validation, and orchestration — improving reliability of debt publication without relying on market-specific rewrites.

cases.title: Data-Core Dashboard Initiative
cases.summary: Designed and implemented an analytics dashboard initiative for B2B operations, evolving it from UI reporting into a decision-support layer used by business teams.
cases.challenge: Operational questions required manual analysis across fragmented data sources, creating slow feedback loops between business, product, and engineering.
cases.approach: Designed a data-core layer with explicit aggregation and filtering logic, then implemented dynamic metric generation so dashboards could adapt to multiple account and product contexts.
cases.outcome: Enabled business users to resolve recurrent operational queries directly from dashboards, reducing dependency on ad-hoc engineering analysis.

cases.title: Web3 Analytics Infrastructure & Payments
cases.summary: Built Web3 analytics infrastructure across multiple engagements, including blockchain analytics dashboards, on-chain user segmentation, NFT ownership metrics, P2P activity analysis, and B2B/B2B2C analytics use cases.
cases.challenge: On-chain and payment data were high-volume, inconsistent across sources, and difficult to convert into product decisions without a clear analytics model.
cases.approach: Structured analytics flows beyond UI concerns: defined reusable metric contracts, aligned wallet/payment events with business dimensions, and implemented dependable query surfaces for product and operations teams.
cases.outcome: Positioned analytics as product infrastructure for Web3 contexts, enabling teams to reason about user behavior and payment activity with consistent system-level signals.

philosophy.title: Architecture & Engineering Philosophy
philosophy.subtitle: Principles I apply consistently — especially under constraint.

principles.title: System-level problem solving
principles.body: I frame incidents and delivery risks as system behaviors, not isolated tickets. The objective is to stabilize the full path from UI to validation and orchestration.

principles.title: Legacy code as architecture context
principles.body: Legacy modules are constraints to model, not noise to ignore. I analyze existing behavior first, then define safe change windows before proposing structural shifts.

principles.title: Incremental improvement under constraints
principles.body: I optimize for architecture that can evolve in controlled steps. Progress is measured by clearer boundaries, fewer regressions, and maintainable handoffs between teams.

principles.title: Refactoring with delivery continuity
principles.body: Refactoring is planned to preserve operational continuity. I prefer reversible changes and explicit rollback paths over big-bang rewrites.

ai.title: AI Workflow System
ai.subtitle: Structured AI integration for full-stack engineering decisions.
ai.description: I treat AI tooling the same way I treat any dependency: with clear contracts, explicit outputs, and honest evaluation of failure modes. AI supports analysis, validation modeling, and architecture checks across frontend and backend boundaries.

layers.detail: AI-assisted requirement decomposition, backend validation modeling, and edge-case mapping. Forces ambiguity to the surface before implementation starts.
Using LLMs as a structured sounding board for tradeoff analysis, data model analysis, and architecture stress testing before decisions are locked.
Structured prompting with explicit constraints (domain context, tech stack, boundary rules). All output is reviewed against codebase contracts and validation paths.
PR descriptions, test scaffolding, documentation drafts, and meeting prep generated from structured context. Removes low-value cognitive load while preserving technical rigor.

delivery.title: Delivery & Leadership
delivery.subtitle: Shipping is a capability, not an outcome.

points.title: Team Enablement over Individual Output
points.body: As TL at Accenture/Santander, my primary measure of success was team velocity and junior engineer growth — not personal throughput. A TL who is the bottleneck has failed.

points.title: Agile as a Delivery Contract
points.body: Sprint ceremonies are only useful if they surface real blockers and reduce uncertainty. I run lean rituals: focused standups, architecture decision records, and explicit dependency mapping.

points.title: Cross-functional Clarity
points.body: I translate between product requirements and technical constraints clearly and without condescension. Non-technical stakeholders deserve the same rigor as technical ones.

points.title: Scope as a Risk Tool
points.body: Scope negotiation is an engineering skill. I surface scope risks early, propose slicing options, and make tradeoffs explicit rather than absorbing them silently.
